scenarioDescription:
The EPIC 220674823 Exoplanetary System


Overview

EPIC 220674823 is a star with 0.97 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.98 times its radius. It is located 797.74 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

EPIC 220674823 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the EPIC 220674823 system


EPIC 220674823 b

EPIC 220674823 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2017-02, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.01 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of EPIC 220674823 b is 7.724 times the mass of Earth. The radius of EPIC 220674823 b is 1.820 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, EPIC 220674823 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


EPIC 220674823 c

EPIC 220674823 c was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2017-02, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of EPIC 220674823 c is 5.803 times the mass of Earth. The radius of EPIC 220674823 c is 2.730 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, EPIC 220674823 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system EPIC 220674823, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: EPIC 220674823 - System With 2 Exoplanets
